# G# Major Scale (Ionian Mode, Shape: C)

The G# Major scale, also known as the Ionian mode, is a diatonic scale consisting of the following notes: G#/Ab, A#/Bb, B/Cb, C#/Db, D#/Eb, F/Fb, and G/Gb. In the context of the C shape on the guitar, it means playing the scale starting from the 8th fret on the low E string. 

## Notes and Intervals
- G#/Ab (1)
- A#/Bb (2)
- B/Cb (3)
- C#/Db (4)
- D#/Eb (5)
- F/Fb (6)
- G/Gb (7)

The intervals between these notes are as follows:
- Root (G#/Ab) - Major 2nd (A#/Bb) - Major 3rd (B/Cb) - Perfect 4th (C#/Db) - Perfect 5th (D#/Eb) - Major 6th (F/Fb) - Major 7th (G/Gb)

## Genre and Flavor
The G# Major scale, like all major scales, has a bright and uplifting quality to it. It is commonly used in a variety of musical genres, including pop, rock, classical, and jazz. The scale evokes feelings of happiness and contentment, making it a popular choice for creating melodies that sound cheerful and positive.
